title: ‘Maggots raining down’: survey lays bare dire state of courts in England and Wales
summary: The Law Society has identified significant issues contributing to a large backlog in legal cases, including the presence of asbestos and feces in detention cells. These hazardous conditions are impacting the functionality of the justice system. The report highlights urgent needs for improvements in prison infrastructure and conditions.

title: Bank of England urged to do more to tackle climate crisis
summary: On the 10th anniversary of Mark Carney's speech addressing short-term horizons in finance, environmental groups are urging immediate action against climate change. They emphasize the urgent need to shift priorities and make long-term sustainable decisions. The call highlights the dwindling time to address critical environmental issues effectively.

title: Entertaining Mr Sloane review – Joe Orton’s murky comedy of despair and desire still unsettles
summary: Tamzin Outhwaite and Jordan Stephens deliver standout performances in Nadia Fall's sharp revival of Joe Orton's 1960s play. The production explores themes of lust and manipulation amidst a vibrant setting. Critics praise the dynamic chemistry and engaging direction.

title: Moderna boss defends UK in drug-pricing row as he opens £150m Oxfordshire facility
summary: Darius Hughes emphasized his company's commitment to investing in the pharmaceutical sector, amidst criticism from competitors. He described their negative sentiments as "a little harsh." Hughes' remarks highlight a focus on positive growth and collaboration in the industry.
